title: I love hearing the accordion. Why don't more people play it? - Quora

response.answer_text: I love hearing the accordion. Why don’t more people play it? Because more people don’t play it.Or, to be less facetious, because it isn’t taught. If more people played it, then more people would teach it, and it would spread. I’ve known one person who played, and one other person who owned an accordion but didn’t play, in my entire life. Until that day when accordions ascend to their proper place at the pinnacle of musical instruments, we’ll just have to settle for listening to Weird Al Yankovic over and over and over and over again.

I love hearing the accordion. Why don't more people play it? I don’t play it because the class of accordion playing my mother signed me up for was canceled I enjoyed playing a toy accordion. That’s why she signed me up, but before I tried finding another class, I lost my desire to learn it. Sorry, but I don’t enjoy the sound as much as you. The bagpipes are what stir my blood, but I think the guitar is my favorite for long-term listening. To answer your question, I don’t know for sure, but I get the idea that most people don’t enjoy the sound as much as other instruments.
